findings.reasoning: This finding identifies a real vulnerability (asset confusion in deposits/withdraw) that is not part of the ground truth. The attack scenario is concrete and profitable, and the fix suggestion is valid. It meets all BONUS_VALID criteria.

This finding identifies a real vulnerability (overborrowing due to ignoring existing borrows) that is not part of the ground truth. The attack scenario is concrete and profitable, and the fix suggestion is valid. It meets all BONUS_VALID criteria.

While the finding correctly identifies a code issue (incorrect parameter to getAssetPrice), the attack scenario is not profitable (DoS without funds loss) and the impact is not critical. The issue exists but is not a security vulnerability under the given criteria (no concrete, profitable exploit).

notes: None of the findings addressed the TARGET vulnerability (price oracle manipulation via Curve pool spot prices). The root cause (oracle reliance on manipulable spot prices without TWAP/external validation) was not identified in any finding, nor were the correct functions (deposit, borrow, getAssetPrice) linked to this specific issue. All findings were about different vulnerabilities or issues.
